result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel J Likness was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Huber with standard release conditions.
Apply 2 days sentence credit, if revoked.

miscConds.notes:
Court costs and DNA surcharge are to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

No contact with Zachery J. or Anna L.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

timeConds.notes: STAYED.  To be used at Agent's discretion and Agent to determine with or without non-working hours.

records.addlTxt: Wis. Dept. of Corrections notice of case status change received.  Outstanding financial obligations have been satisfied.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Daniel J Likness in court with attorney Craig Michael Kuhary.  Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 2.  Court finds defendant guilty. Ct. 1 dismissed and read-in. Defense requests another date for sentencing. Defense is in a treatment course. Court grants request. Bail remains as fixed.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 14, 2015 at 09:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 1, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Daniel J Likness in court with attorney Craig Michael Kuhary.  Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense requests plea and sentencing date.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 1, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Daniel J Likness in court with attorney  Breanna Bucher for Atty. Craig Michael Kuhary.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for July 20, 2015 at 09:30 am.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.   Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant to have no contact with victim/witness listed in the Criminal Complaint.
Waukesha County Pretrial Screening Services Report by Wisconsin Community Services filed.

Defendant Daniel J Likness in court, in custody, with attorney Mark Powers for Matthew Huppertz.   Kevin M. Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Arraignment scheduled for June 8, 2015 at 10:00 am.
